FAQs

What is the warranty period on the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro?

The warranty period on all Beyerdynamic products is 2 years. For more warranty details click here.

How is the overall sound of Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro?

Beyerdynamic is a German brand that has made its mark as a fine headphone manufacturer and the DT 770 Pro model comes with a bass heavy and a clean powerful sound.

Are the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro ideal for DJs?

No, they are not. You can have a look at the V-MODA Crossfade LP2 as it is ideal for DJ and live shows.

Is the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro open-back?

No, it does not come with open-back design. If you are looking for a wide soundstage our top recommendation will be the Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro. It features an open-back design with much more detailing as compared to the DT 770 PRO.

Does Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro come with a mic?

No, the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro does not come with a mic since it is more of a studio monitoring headphone.

Is Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro an over the ear or on the ear product?

It is a closed-back over-the-ear headphone which makes listening to music even better thanks to its natural noise isolation.

How is the overall fit?

Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro fits on the ear so don't go expecting the earcups to envelop your ears in lush comfort.

Does Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro have detachable cables?

No, Unfortunately it does not come with a detachable cable feature.

Do you need an Amplifier for 80 Ohms or 250 Ohms?

Yes, since the driver units are bigger, they will need an amplifier so that the headphones can performance to its full potential.

How do these stack up against Ultrasone Performance 820?

Apart from both these headphones being able to be driven easily by your smartphones it is also a choice between a warm and smooth sound against a balanced sound. Read more comparison between the two headphones here

Will the DT 1770 Pro replace the DT 770 Pro?

No, the DT 1770 Pro is an upgraded version of the DT 770 PRO, made for audio engineers, producers, and musicians who need a pair of high-end studio headphones without compromising on performance in all the aspects such as sound, design, comfort, and accessories. The DT 770 Pro is for beginners who want a reliable, robust, and affordable pair of headphones to work with.

What is the difference between Pro and edition models of DT 770, DT 880, and DT 990?

The Pro series is designed for professional users and the Edition series are designed for end users. Also, the Pro and Edition series do not differ noticeably in terms of sound provided that they have the same impedance (e.g. the 250 ohms DT 880 Edition and the 250 ohms DT 880 Pro sound the same).

Which hard case can I buy for my DT 770 Pro?

You can get the Beyerdynamic - DT Hard Case for your DT 770 Pro.

Why isn't there a 600-ohms version of the DT 770 Pro models?

In professional environments most headphone outputs aren't designed for 600-ohms headphones, we only offer headphones with a maximum impedance of 250-ohms.

Why does my DT 770/990 Pro have another connection cable with a smaller thread?

In order to be able to plug the headphones with the 3.5 mm jack (unscrewed jack adapter) into a mobile device with a bumper, the M8 thread, which was previously available, was converted to a smaller M5 thread. If your headphones have such an M5 thread you will need an adapter. If you own an M8 threaded jack adapter you can still use it for your headphones, but only as a plug adapter.

What's the difference between the DT770/990 Pro and the DT 1770/1990 Pro?

The DT 770/990 Pro is made for beginners musicians, sound engineers, producers who are looking for a reliable, sturdy, and affordable pair of headphones as a working device. The DT 1770/1990 Pro was developed for sound engineers, producers, and musicians looking for a pair of high-end studio headphones with uncompromising performance in all relevant aspects such as sound, design, comfort, and accessories.

Do you need an Amplifier for 80 Ohms or 250 Ohms?

Yes, since the driver units are bigger, they will need an amplifier so that the headphones can performance to its full potential.

How do these stack up against Ultrasone Performance 820?

Will the DT 1770 Pro replace the DT 770 Pro?

No, the DT 1770 Pro is an upgraded version of the DT 770 PRO, made for audio engineers, producers, and musicians who need a pair of high-end studio headphones without compromising on performance in all the aspects such as sound, design, comfort, and accessories. The DT 770 Pro is for beginners who want a reliable, robust, and affordable pair of headphones to work with.

What is the difference between Pro and edition models of DT 770, DT 880, and DT 990?

The Pro series is designed for professional users and the Edition series are designed for end users. Also, the Pro and Edition series do not differ noticeably in terms of sound provided that they have the same impedance (e.g. the 250 ohms DT 880 Edition and the 250 ohms DT 880 Pro sound the same).

Which hard case can I buy for my DT 770 Pro?

You can get the Beyerdynamic - DT Hard Case for your DT 770 Pro.

Why isn't there a 600-ohms version of the DT 770 Pro models?

In professional environments most headphone outputs aren't designed for 600-ohms headphones, we only offer headphones with a maximum impedance of 250-ohms.

Why does my DT 770/990 Pro have another connection cable with a smaller thread?

In order to be able to plug the headphones with the 3.5 mm jack (unscrewed jack adapter) into a mobile device with a bumper, the M8 thread, which was previously available, was converted to a smaller M5 thread. If your headphones have such an M5 thread you will need an adapter. If you own an M8 threaded jack adapter you can still use it for your headphones, but only as a plug adapter.

What's the difference between the DT770/990 Pro and the DT 1770/1990 Pro?

The DT 770/990 Pro is made for beginners musicians, sound engineers, producers who are looking for a reliable, sturdy, and affordable pair of headphones as a working device. The DT 1770/1990 Pro was developed for sound engineers, producers, and musicians looking for a pair of high-end studio headphones with uncompromising performance in all relevant aspects such as sound, design, comfort, and accessories.

PRAVEEN KAMATH
Headphone Guru

About PRAVEEN KAMATH
Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! You'll often find him listening to The Weeknd, The Score and The Script.

DESCRIPTION

TRUSTED BY PROFESSIONALS, A BENCHMARK FOR STUDIO SOUND

The DT 990 Pro are circumaural headphones that house extremely strong neodymium magnet systems offering highly detailed sound reproduction quality. These open-back studio headphones are a reliable tool for professionals for mixing, mastering and recording purposes. The wide stereo image and three-dimensional sound reproduction make the beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro headphones a loyal companion for producers. Outstanding tonal depth ensures that even small changes in the positioning of the acoustic source can be perceived while mixing.

NATURAL BASS AND TREBLE

The open back design allows the headphones to breathe, which creates beautiful natural sounding music that you are bound to enjoy. These have a special diffuse-field design, that make these quality products apt for studio usage.The diaphragm has been made extremely light for better impulse performance. Also the high quality design only helps in better sonic experience delivering a surreal soundstage experience and natural sound.

OPEN CIRCUMAURAL DESIGN FOR DETAILING

TThe DT 990 Pro features an open-back circumaural over-the-ear design for rich audio performance that's designed for critical listening and a more natural sound stage. This increased efficiency also leaves the DT 990 Pro with greater power reserves for a succinct linear response that is especially suited for high-achieving audio applications where appropriate sonic reproduction is of paramount importance, and dedicated equipment is available such as a headphone amplifier.

ADJUSTABLE HEADBAND, VELOUR EARPADS FOR ADDED COMFORT

How is the overall sound of Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro?

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro come with a mic?

Is Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro an over the ear or on the ear product?

It is a semi open over-the-ear headphone which gives a slightly increased sound isolation and reduced noise leakage

How is the overall fit?

Beyerdynamic DT 990Â Pro comes with an adjustable headband so that it firmly and comfortably cradles your head.

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro have detachable cables?

No,it does not have detachable cable.

Which devices are compatible?

The DT 990 Pro is compatible with Android and iOS devices as well as studio monitoring eqiupments.

Is Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro good for long useage?

Yes, due to it being durable, lightweight and soft earpads make music listening for long hours comfortable

Does it need an Amplifier?

Yes, since the driver units are bigger, they will need an amplifier so that the headphones can performance to its full potential.

Which hard case can I buy for my Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro?

You can get the Beyerdynamic - DT Hard Case for your DT 990 Pro.

Why isn't there a 600-ohms version of DT 990 Pro?

Since most headphone output in professional environments isn't designed for 600-ohms headphones, Beyerdynamic only offers headphones with a maximum impedance of 250-ohms.

What is the technical difference between DT 880/990 edition and DT 880/990 Pro?

The Pro series is designed for professional users and the Edition series are designed for end users. Also, the Pro and Edition series do not differ noticeably in terms of sound provided that they have the same impedance (e.g. the 250 ohms DT 880 Edition and the 250 ohms DT 880 Pro sound the same).

How does the Tygr 300 R differ from the DT 880 Pro and the DT 990 Pro?

The DT 880 PRO has a very linear frequency response, while the DT 990 PRO has a slightly more accentuated bass and accordingly more present trebles for a pleasant balance. Both are primarily designed for studio applications. The TYGR 300 R focuses on gaming. Powerful bass and detailed accentuated treble go very well with gaming. However, the sound design of the DT 990 PRO has been further optimized for gaming, sometimes through the use of a special acoustic fleece.

How can I tell what the impedance of my DT 770/880/990 Edition is?

You check the impedance of the integrated sound transducers from the connection plug. The impedance is sometimes hot-embossed onto the plastic shaft of the plug: If there is nothing there, the model has an impedance of 250 ohms. If it reads 32 Î©, the model has an impedance of 32 ohms. If it reads 600 Î©, the model has an impedance of 600 ohms.

What do "impedance" and "ohms" mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Î©, 32 Î©, and 80 Î© are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Î© are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Î© like the T 1.

Are the DT 990 Pro Available with less headband pressure?

No, the professional headphones are only available with the defined headband pressure. If the headband pressure is too strong for you, you can slightly try to expand the installed spring steel in the headband. For this purpose, we recommend stretching the headphones gradually for a few hours over books or similar. You should choose the width a little bit wider than the width of your head.

SERVICE DETAILS

WARRANTY
NA

DESCRIPTION

Jerry Harvey
Jerry Harvey started his career as a sound engineer and shortly he picked up the legendary band Van Halen. Jerry Harvey thus came about the world's first Custom In-Ear Monitor. This became extremely popular with the band members and then he started making them for other brands as well. Jerry finally founded JH audio in 2007 as a manufacturer of custom aviation headsets and then started producing the JH Audio Pro series for professionals and audiophiles alike.

Performance-Series
For a custom-like experience, Jerry Harvey Audio has introduced the Performance series Universal Fit IEMs. These Universal series allows you to hear the music how the recording artist and mix engineer intended. The models achieve what no others have before: a smaller shell size to ensure proper fit, retention and an acoustic seal for a perfect IEM experience.

Endorsed & Used by the Worldâ€™s biggest Rockstars
JH Audio's Universal Fit Performance Series IEMs are currently endorsed and used by the worldâ€™s biggest touring artists like U2, Lady Gaga, Drake, Guns & Roses, Alicia Keys, and so many more. The Performance series is very popular and highly rated.

Hancrafted in USA

Handcrafted, Never Mass-Produced

The Performance Series is truly exquisite in its design. After the unique shells go through the 3D printing process, the Universal IEMs are then, one pair at a time, finished and assembled in the JHA facility. Unlike other manufacturers that only match their IEMs within 3db +/- of their reference curves, JH Audio tests and matches their Universal IEMs to within an astounding 1db +/- of their reference curve. This level of attention to detail is simply unheard in this industry.

SoundrIVe Technology (Quad Driver Technology)
JH16V2 is equipped with SoundrIVe Technology, using Jerry Harvey Audioâ€™s proprietary mini quad drivers. The JH16V2 has a 10 driver configuration: quad drivers for the lows, dual drivers for the mids, and quad drivers for the highs. The FreqPhase corrects time and phase of multiple drivers. The waveguide ensures each driver signal arrives within 0.01 milliseconds, leading to a Phase coherent IEM.

Variable Bass Output that is Adjustable from the Cable
You can control the low frequency drivers with the adjustable bass (0 - +10dB) from the cable itself. Frequency ranges from flat bass response up to +10dB (10Hz to 100Hz). The 4-pin cable connection from Moon Audio, thatâ€™s known for their incredible cables, provide a more secure and strong connection with the earpiece. It also helps to protect it from sweat and dust.

Yearlong Research for the Most Optimum Fit
JH Audio is renowned worldwide for their custom IEMs that provide deep bass response and excellent sonic performance. With this kind of expertise, it was only natural that the engineers fine tune their Universal IEMs fit-wise, to be as close to Custom IEMs as possible. JH Audioâ€™s guys analyzed over 30,000 sets of ear molds in their Orlando Lab to find similarities in order to create the Performance Series IEMs. What they found was that most of the sound bores on Custom IEMs bore a similarity of having a 10% angle. Having identified this, JH Audio made the necessary sound bore adjustments and refined the shape of the ear bowl and helix area. The result? A Universal IEM that fits and seals almost as well as a Custom IEM.

Stunning Custom Black Pearl Faceplates

Everything about the JH Audio Performance Series of Universal IEMs is stunning. Its new custom black pearl faceplates are adorned with oversized JH logos which you'd think look too over-the-top, but actually look pretty darn good-looking! The JH16V2 has an impressive and sophisticated crossover network. This crossover circuit combined with the Freqphase waveguide and new proprietary quad drivers deliver an audio quality that is perfect for the recording studio, or for listening to exactly what the mixer/producer and band wanted you to hear, mixing your own tracks or performing live.

title: Sennheiser - HD 800 S
description:
Designed in Germany

Balanced Sound Signature

2 Years of Warranty

Ideal for Audiophiles

Ideal for Movies and TV

Open-Back Design

56mm Dynamic Drivers

Needs Amplification

Replaceable Cables

DESCRIPTION

OUTSTANDING REFERENCE QUALITY AUDIO REPRODUCTION

The Sennheiser HD 800s sport an open, circum-aural dynamic stereo headphone design that makes you feel directly connected to the music. Music emerges from silence and sounds so profound that would travel into a soundstage of amazement. Soundstage refers to being able to sense the spatial surroundings of a recording.

PATENTED DYNAMIC TRANSDUCER TECHNOLOGY

Headphones have always had a basic physics problem when it comes to transducers. Better sound always requires a larger surface area but this also results in more distortion due to oscillation at high frequencies. Sennheiser essentially blew everyoneâ€™s mind when they showed off the Neodymium-powered two-layer ring radiator inside the HD 800 S. Firing at your ear in a strategic 60-degree angle to simulate free-air sound arrivals it has claimed to sport the largest diameter ever seen for such applications.

RING RADIATOR DRIVER TECHNOLOGY FOR CONTROLLED OSCILLATIONS

The 56mm or 2.205" (with a 40mm voice coil) is twice the size of your average tweeter. Generally, you don't encounter them until you shell out about 100 times that for the full speaker. This results in controlled oscillations, which leave the headphones to do what headphones do best, that is create the best and clearest sound possible.

COMFORTABLE CIRCUMAURAL DESIGN WITH ALCANTARA EARCUPS

The Japanese Alcantra Earcups boast of suede-like fabric material that youâ€™ll find used for the interior of many high-end automobiles and racecars. It definitely feels like an airy version of suede, as it doesn't have the heft of most leather materials. Also the fabric breathes, which is great for long listening sessions when you donâ€™t want to have to air out your ears. Handcrafted ear pads made of high-quality microfiber fabric and the ear cups are covered with a thin metallic mesh.

INGENIOUS KEVLAR-REINFORCED CABLES FOR MINIMAL LOSS

3 meters of fabric-sheathed Kevlar-reinforced Teflon-insulated 4-strand straight OFC copper wire in a Y harness. The cable is covered with a fabric sheath, making it flexible and non-microphonic. Two connection leads, a 6.3mm connector and an XLR-4 balanced cable to offer even better quality sound from sources with balanced outputs.

OPEN-BACK DESIGN FOR AN AIRY, EXPANSIVE SOUNDSTAGE

Any set of headphones that give a real sense of â€˜being thereâ€™ are open-backed, meaning that air and sound can come in and out of the headphones. The sound has less of a â€˜laboratory feelâ€™ this way. Itâ€™s not great for noise isolation, as people will be able to hear whatever music or movies that youâ€™re listening to.

DESIGNED KEEPING WEIGHT DISTRIBUTION AND COMFORTABILITY IN MIND

The headphones come in at a pretty heavy sounding 11.5 oz (or 330 grams for the metric folk), but they manage to distribute the weight evenly so that you donâ€™t really notice the weight at all. They are large headphones and cover even the largest of ears. But they feel light and after a two-hour film, your head wonâ€™t be sore at all.

What is the warranty period on the Sennheiser HD800s?

Whats the difference between an Open-Back and Closed-Back headphone?

We have an article to help you understand better the difference between Open Back and Closed Back Headphones.

Does it have Noise Isolation?

No, Itâ€™s not great for noise isolation as it's an open back headphone and it won't shut out any external noise.

The Sennheiser 800s sounds so amazing that it would make you feel like a live stage performance on every track.

Will I need an Amp?

The Sennheiser HD800s will need an amp, we recommend you read our article on Why you may need an Amp to help you take a decision.

What is the difference between 800 and 800s ?

The 800S driver is a modified version of the 800 driver. This new modified driver smooths over the 6 kHz peak on the 800 which some people thought made it sound fatiguing. It also makes the sound feel a bit more full bodied and comparatively warmer.
